title: The Architecture City: BLOX in Copenhagen
itunes:title: The Architecture City: BLOX in Copenhagen
description: The design of radical buildings in historic cities often stirs up debate. Are we afraid of architectural change? Do we eventually come to love these buildings? OMA architect and partner Ellen van Loon chats with DAC’s Director Kent Martinussen and host Frederikke Aagaard about the design of BLOX and the conversation it has sparked among residents and visitors in Copenhagen about design.
content:encoded: The design of radical buildings in historic cities often stirs up debate. Are we afraid of architectural change? Do we eventually come to love these buildings? OMA architect and partner Ellen van Loon chats with DAC’s Director Kent Martinussen and host Frederikke Aagaard about the design of BLOX and the conversation it has sparked among residents and visitors in Copenhagen about design.
itunes:subtitle: An interview med Ellen van Loon from OMA and Kent Martinussen, CEO, Danish Architecture Center
itunes:author: Danish Architecture Center
